sourceMeaningMnemonic: What's that in the  <radical>dirt </radical>, a  <radical>gun </radical>? It has its  <radical>mouth</radical> wide open, almost like it's hungry. And what does one serve a hungry gun? A  <radical>plate</radical> of <kanji>salt</kanji>, of course!
meaningInfo: Imagine randomly finding a gun in the dirt, looking at you with its mouth wide open. So naturally, you feed it a heaping plate of salt. A perfect diet for any hungry gun.
readingMnemonic: While feeding <kanji>salt</kanji> to this hungry gun, you laugh, "<reading>She owe</reading>s (<ja>しお</ja>) me for this!" Who is she, you ask? The lady who keeps putting all these guns in the dirt and then running off!
readingInfo: One day you'll find this lady who keeps putting all the guns in the dirt, and she'll owe you big. Until then, just keep feeding salt to those guns!
